Hmmmm,
I'm running those constructions all the time.
One of my projects looks like:
source/
       com.weacc.keeper.controller
            PackingConroller.java
       com.weacc.keeper.view
       com.weacc.keeper.model
       test.weacc.keeper.controller
            PackingControllerTest.java
       test.weacc.keeper.view
       test.weacc.keeper.model

In PackingControllerTest.java I import the stuff I need
e.g.:
      import com.weacc.keeper.packing.controller.*;
      import com.weacc.keeper.model.*;

Eclipse never complained....

Markus

>
> Hi,
>
> Has anyone had any success getting Eclipse to understand a project
> whose junit code is organized as follows:
>
>    src/
>        java/
>             a/b/c
>        test/
>             a/b/c
>
> I imagine it can be done, but I've not been able to get Eclipse to
> shut up - it says it can't find src/test's dependencies, ie the ones
> in src/java
>
